definition: to make a comparison/to engage in a contest
Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)

sentences.english: Let's examine the way the book cites a few idols of Western culture.
sentences.chinese: 且書中引用的幾位西方文化偶像來約略比一比異同。

sentences.english: Now I can compete with our Xibe friends.
sentences.chinese: 可以好好跟錫伯族的朋友們比一比。

sentences.english: I always play the piano on weekends.
sentences.chinese: 比一比，看誰用第一人稱說週末活動又快又好？

sentences.english: Let's see who is heavier and who is thinner.
sentences.chinese: 請同學拿着體檢表與好朋友比一比，看誰重誰輕。

sentences.english: Take out your pencils, page39, fill in the blanks. (
sentences.chinese: 拿出鉛筆，和老師比一比，看誰填得又快又好吧。

definition: not to know one's place
to bet/to make a bet/a wager
equally matched/about the same
not much to choose between the two/tweedledum and tweedledee
bring it on!/who's afraid?/who cares?
lit. unable to distinguish eldest brother from second brother (idiom); they are all equally excellent/nothing to choose between them
erhua variant of 較勁|较劲[jiao4 jin4]
arm wrestling
who/also pr. [shui2]
relative superiority (better or worse, stronger or weaker, above or below etc)
inferior/not up to par/to fall far short/to be mistaken
to step down gracefully (humble expression)/to concede defeat/to play second fiddle
slightly better/a cut above
however strong you are, there is always someone stronger (idiom)/there is always sth more to learn/never be satisfied to rest on your laurels/there is no room for complacency
